results.title: Airplanes: how they fly
results.creator_credit: Hal Kopel and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Two children learn from a model airplane enthusiast how an airplane’s wings keep it in the air and how the propeller makes it move forward. The children go for an airplane ride and the pilot demonstrates the controls and explains how they work.
results.description: Two children learn from a model airplane enthusiast how an airplane’s wings keep it in the air and how the propeller makes it move forward. The children go for an airplane ride and the pilot demonstrates the controls and explains how they work.

results.title: Airplanes and how they fly. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Explains basic principles involved in launching, flying, and controlling an airplane. Uses animation to demonstrate how the shape of the airfoil produces lift during flight. Also features some of the most modern aircraft in the world.

results.title: Airhawk: star of the north
results.creator_credit: Ron McLean Productions, Ron McLean, Colin Eggleston and David Baker
results.brief_description: Jim Hawk, outback pilot and adventurer, is wanted by a group of international diamond dealers. When he starts investigating his brother’s murder, Hawk finds himself on the hit list. Conspiracy and murder follow him from Hong Kong to the Gold Coast and then to outback Queensland, as Hawk struggles to uncover the ringleaders and avenge his brother’s death. Based on the cartoon series created by John Dixon the film stars Eric Oldfield and Louise Howitt.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron McLean Productions, Ron McLean, Colin Eggleston and David Baker

results.title: Aircraft; Jellyfish of the sky
results.creator_credit: Richard Longley and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Aircraft traces the history, sociology and technology of aircraft from the first flight of the Wright Brothers in 1903, the “barnstorming” era, the coming of the first airlines, the transformation of combat in two world wars to highly computerised airlines and jet-fighters. “Jellyfish of the sky” also known as balloons and airships, were the first flying machines. In 1783, the first hot air balloon was flown. Two weeks later, the hydrogen balloon took to the air. This program explains the importance of these events.
results.description:

results.title: Aircraft maintenance
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”
Discusses general overhaul maintenance of aircraft, whether it be commercial, passer or light aircraft. Includes TAA, Qantas, East-West, Cessner airlines. Also talks about testing and checking procedures and what the engineer should be looking for; the role of the engineer and qualifications required for this career.

results.title: Airborne
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson, New Zealand National Film Unit and Chris Dillon
